reviewText:
Remember a previous review of mine? It was about the 6-in-1 Bundle from Alawar, with the excellent Mexicana: Deadly Holidays and the fact that for once, the action was set during a Mexican celebration. Well, the life is weird because I've played Lost Legends: The Weeping Woman without even knowing the plot and I ended up with a legend from San Cristobal, with a celebration where you see also skulls masks and other accessories around deaths.

The Weeping Woman is a woman that lost her husband and her children to another girl and that drowned herself in the river nearby. Children were disappearing, so the villagers created a celebration to appease the sad spirit. However, while it was calm for years, now, drama is happening around. You're sent to San Cristobal as a reporter, however, you'll be thrown into a kid's disappearance... Is it really the Weeping Woman?

The plot is well-done: while you're doubting that it's the spirit behind the disappearances, the truth was shocking in the end. I loved the fact that it sets during a celebration and that you have such mysteries around a legend. You're even visiting ruins at the end, changing from the little village and from the country.

While the gameplay is the same as any of the hidden object games here, I found the scenes very easy and the puzzles not very complicated, even if some can be seen as hard as it needs some logic that usually fails me. However, you don't have the instructions at first sight, to know what you need to do, you have to click on a button. I don't like usually not being told first about the rules.

Given the fact that the game is a collector's edition, you can find a bonus chapter: San Cristobal needs you because of another legend: El Sombreron is enchanting girls that fall into a coma after having their hair being braided. You'll also find concept arts, wallpapers, etc...

I loved the graphics. I loved that little village and the atmosphere typically in full celebration mode. I also liked a lot the passage in the ruins. As for the soundtrack, it was very well fitting.

Lost Legends: The Weeping Woman is a nice casual games, that will enjoy any hardcore gamer or newbie in the genre, so, it's a good purchase, though I would wait for a price drop or for a discount.

reviewText: Another nice chapter of the Lost Legends' series. This Hidden Object game takes the player in a little town where the people live in fear of a ghost that every year kidnaps a child, there's even a short bonus chapter and other extras, achievements are in-game only not on Steam. Graphics are very good and there are several locations but the puzzles and the HO scenes are very easy even at the highest difficulty. It's an enjoyable game and I recommend it to both experts and beginners.
